com.google.gwt.gears.client.localserver
Class LocalServer

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      com.google.gwt.gears.client.localserver.LocalServer

public final class LocalServer
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject

A factory and container for the set of ResourceStores and ManagedResourceStores your application creates and uses. Use resource stores to enable your JavaScript application to execute without a network connection.

LocalServer

Method Detail

canServeLocally

public boolean canServeLocally(java.lang.String url)
                        throws GearsException
Returns true if a request for the URL can be satisfied from any of the resource stores available, taking into account whether the containing store is enabled and if its requiredCookie matches. Relative URLs are interpreted according to the current page location. Returns true if the URL can be served locally.

Parameters:
url - the URL to test
Returns:
true if a request for the URL can be satisfied from any of the resource stores available
Throws:
GearsException - if the URL is not from the same origin as the current page

createManagedStore

public ManagedResourceStore createManagedStore(java.lang.String name)
Opens an existing ManagedResourceStore or creates a new one if no such store exists.

Parameters:
name - of the ManagedResourceStore
Returns:
ManagedResourceStore instance

createManagedStore

public ManagedResourceStore createManagedStore(java.lang.String name,
                                               java.lang.String requiredCookie)
Opens an existing ManagedResourceStore or creates a new one if no such store exists. The combination of name and requiredCookie (along with the domain) identify a unique store. Expected cookie format is "name=value".

Parameters:
name - of the ManagedResourceStore
requiredCookie - cookie formatted as "name=value"
Returns:
ManagedResourceStore instance

createStore

public ResourceStore createStore(java.lang.String name)
Opens an existing ResourceStore or creates a new one if no such store exists.

Parameters:
name - name of the ResourceStore
Returns:
ResourceStore instance

createStore

public ResourceStore createStore(java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String requiredCookie)
Opens an existing ResourceStore or creates a new one if no such store exists. If a requiredCookie is given, creates a ResourceStore that requires the cookie to be present in the client in order to serve the contents from the store. The combination of name and requiredCookie (along with the domain) identify a unique store. Expected cookie format is "name=value".

Parameters:
name - name of the ResourceStore
requiredCookie - cookie formatted as "name=value"
Returns:
ResourceStore instance

openManagedStore

public ManagedResourceStore openManagedStore(java.lang.String name)
Opens an existing ManagedResourceStore or returns null if no such store exists.

Parameters:
name - name of the ManagedResourceStore
Returns:
existing ManagedResourceStore or returns null if no such store exists.

openManagedStore

public ManagedResourceStore openManagedStore(java.lang.String name,
                                             java.lang.String requiredCookie)
Opens an existing ManagedResourceStore or returns null if no such store exists. The combination of name and requiredCookie (along with the domain) identify a unique store. Expected cookie format is "name=value".

Parameters:
name - name of the ManagedResourceStore
requiredCookie - cookie formatted as "name=value"
Returns:
existing ManagedResourceStore or returns null if no such store exists.

openStore

public ResourceStore openStore(java.lang.String name)
Opens an existing ResourceStore or returns null if no such store exists. If the store was originally created with a requiredCookie, the same value must be provided in order to open this ResourceStore. *

Parameters:
name - name of the ResourceStore
Returns:
existing ResourceStore or returns null if no such store exists.

openStore

public ResourceStore openStore(java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String requiredCookie)
Opens an existing ResourceStore or returns null if no such store exists. If the store was originally created with a requiredCookie, the same value must be provided in order to open this ResourceStore. The combination of name and requiredCookie (along with the domain) identify a unique store. Expected cookie format is "name=value".

Parameters:
name - name of the ResourceStore
requiredCookie - cookie formatted as "name=value"
Returns:
existing ResourceStore or returns null if no such store exists.

removeManagedStore

public void removeManagedStore(java.lang.String name)
Removes a ManagedResourceStore and all of its contained URLs from the local cache.

Parameters:
name - name of the ManagedResourceStore to remove

removeManagedStore

                               java.lang.String requiredCookie)
Removes a ManagedResourceStore and all of its contained URLs from the local cache.

Parameters:
name - name of the ManagedResourceStore
requiredCookie - cookie formatted as "name=value"

removeStore

name - name of the ResourceStore
